cases=subset_canceled[(subset_canceled['lead_time']>214)&(subset_canceled['lead_time']<365)]['hotel'].count()
print('Probability of booking getting canceled given that lead time is between 214 days and 300 days= ',cases/total)

source.80eda022:
x=[]
y=[]
for i in range(400):
    total=data[(data['lead_time']>214)&(data['lead_time']<i)]['hotel'].count()
    cases=subset_canceled[(subset_canceled['lead_time']>214)&(subset_canceled['lead_time']<i)]['hotel'].count()
    x.append(i)
    y.append((cases/total))
plt.scatter(x,y)
plt.title('Probability of booking cancelation vs max. lead time')
#plt.xlabel('Number of days')
#plt.ylabel('Probability of booking getting canceled')
plt.show()
source.cc388026:
subset_booked.groupby('arrival_date_year')['hotel'].count()
subset_booked_2015=subset_booked[subset_booked['arrival_date_year']==2015]
subset_booked_2016=subset_booked[subset_booked['arrival_date_year']==2016]
subset_booked_2017=subset_booked[subset_booked['arrival_date_year']==2017]
months=['January','February','March','April','May','June','July','August','September','October','November','December']
booking_2015=[]
booking_2016=[]
booking_2017=[]
for i in months:
    num_15=subset_booked_2015[subset_booked_2015['arrival_date_month']==i]['hotel'].count()
    num_16=subset_booked_2016[subset_booked_2016['arrival_date_month']==i]['hotel'].count()
    num_17=subset_booked_2017[subset_booked_2017['arrival_date_month']==i]['hotel'].count()
    booking_2015.append(num_15)
    booking_2016.append(num_16)
    booking_2017.append(num_17)
plt.figure(figsize=(20,20))
plt.plot(months,booking_2015,label='2015')
plt.plot(months,booking_2016,label='2016')
plt.plot(months,booking_2017,label='2017')
plt.legend()
plt.show()
print('Mean bookings in 2016= ',round(np.array(booking_2016).mean()),0)
print('Median bookings in 2016= ',np.median(np.array(booking_2016)))

source.551ed62b: The probability of booking getting canceled is 7%. However, if the lead time is between 214 days and 365 days, then it becomes 9 times more likely that the booking will get canceled.
source.a23d4622: The hotel has very poor client retention as only 3% of the total bookings are made by previous customers.
source.a39af18d: The hotel saw maximum bookings made in 2016, when initially there were very few bookings initially before it picked up from March to May. The business picked up again in between September to November which is usually the peak season.
source.fe6b0647:
**Expenditure pattern of majority**

Usually Spanish customers have higher variability (68-140 USD/day). Germans seem to be 'more frugal' customers as they spend more or less around their median value of 98 USD/day. Both countries have their median values nearly around typical value for hotel's top clientage. Most of the Italians and Belgians spend more than what majority of the top clientage spends.Portugal despite contributing to majority of the top clientage has mostly little frugal customers. However, it has the most number of very extravagant customers, as well who can boost the hotel business. 

Thus, advertising efforts should strategically target customer base in Spain, Italy, Portugal and Belgium.
source.f5d811ca:
Top 5% countries with maximum number of visitors contribute to 74% of the hotel stays. All these are situated in Western Europe and are  Belgium,Germany,Spain, France, UK,Ireland, Italy, Netherlands, PortugaL 

**Hotel will see rise in bookings if they focus their advertising efforts more towards these countries**
source.9cf0c10e:
# How EDA can help drive the hotel business

The below exploratory data analysis (EDA) has been performed on a database of hotel booking data in USA. It demonstrates the power of exploratory data analysis. Following key insights are drawn from the analysis-
* 37% of bookings in 2015-17 were cancelled
* Most of the bookings were made within 113 to 214 days prior to checking in. In fact, a booking made more than 214 days before the check-in date and within a year, was 9 times more likely to be cancelled.
* 2016 was the most busy year for the hotel. Bookings tend to be more during winter and also during summer.
* Only 3% of all the bookings were made by previous customers.
* Just 9 European countries contrbute to 74% of all the confirmed bookings.These are the most frequent client countries for the hotel.
* Portuguese,Dutch,Italians,French, Spanish,German and Belgian visitors prefer mostly city hotels whereas Irish and British visitors prefer resort hotels. None of these customers brought children with them during the stay. 
* All the confirmed bookings were made by corporate clients mostly through travel agents, tour operators and direct channels. Portuguese clients booked mostly in groups.
* There is a healthy competition amongst travel agencies in the most frequent client countries.
* It is observed that countries with less bookings tend to spend more lavishly during their stay. However, weak correlation rules out the possibility of linear corelation. 
* In the consumer base of each country, there are extravagant customers.


**Action plan**
* Organization should improve their customer loyalty program to improve customer retention. It should target strategically the customer base in Portugal, Netherlands, Italy, France, Spain, Germany, Belgium.
* For customers booking more than 214 days before the check-in date, other prospective customers need to be put on waiting list in order to ensure hotel rooms stay occupied as the probability of such a customer cancelling the booking is high.
* Hotel should engage more with travel agencies and tour operators while encouraging healthy competion amongst them to increase customer influx. It should consider giving attractive discounts on group bookings to its Portuguese customer base.
* Cause of low number of bookings of customers who spent high amount of money during their stay needs to be investigated - whether it is due to poor satisfaction level or any other factor is influencing their decision
source.97cf3e55: All the bookings made were from companies and mostly were made for two people per room.
source.53f6a7c1: Countries having the least number of bookings are observed to spend more per day of their stay. However, as evident from the weak correlation coefficient, it is not linearly dependent. Mean is observed to be having medium correlation with standard deviation, indicating that rise in mean per day expenditure is mostly due to outliers and not due to consistent rise across the customer base.
source.94089ffa: Portuguese,Dutch,Italians,French, Spanish,German and Belgians stayed mostly in city hotels whereas Irish and Britishers stayed in resort hotels
source.4fb2d555: Portuguese,Dutch,Italians,French, Spanish,German and Belgians prefer mostly city hotels whereas Irish and Britishers prefer resort hotels.
source.d8a85d13: 83% of the people from top clients who stayed in the hotel booked through TAs,TOs and direct channels. Travel operators and tour operators are lucrative channels in which the hotel needs to encourage more by stimulating competition. Portugal is an exception where most customers staying the hotel booked in groups. So, giving attractive discount offers on group bookings will be a good strategy to adopt for Portugese customer base.
source.a00dd569: Different travel agencies are bring highest customers in different countries. This indicates healthy competition among travel agencies and is healthy for the hotel business. Overall, agency no.9 brings most number of clients with its major clientage in France.
source.cc362f9f: Number of cancellations is nearly half of that of number of confirmed bookings. 50% of the cancellations have been made between 113 days and 214 days before the check-in date. In cases of confirmed bookings, the lead time is more concentrated at around 45 days with fewer such bookings made before 300 days
